intro: Carmichaelia monroi, commonly known as the Stewart Island kōwhai, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows as a small shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are trifoliate, with three oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces pods that contain seeds. Carmichaelia monroi is adapted to the coastal and forested habitats of Stewart Island.
